document_data.name: Dweomerflow
document_data.mainbody: '''''Dweomerflow''''' was an [[alteration]] [[spell]] used in the [[item enchantment|creation]] of [[:Category:magic items|magical items]].

Effects.Divine Use:
A fountain of [[holy water]], ''[[consecrate]]d'' altar or similar [[divine]] site could store a dozen or so spells that had been accompanied by a casting of ''dweomerflow''. They could then have been gradually released by someone of the same faith to which the site was sanctified. More powerful spells required a casting of ''[[abeyance]]'' in addition to ''dweomerflow''.

Many holy sites scattered across [[Faer√ªn]] were well-protected by powerful offensive spells that were released if they were intruded upon by the faithless. This magic was often stored within a ''[[holy symbol]]'' that was doubtlessly present at the divine location. To bypass these spell effects, a [[cold iron]] tool could be used to remove the symbol, circumventing the effects of ''dweomerflow''.
